element.name: AED Use Prior to EMS Arrival
element.definition: Documentation of AED use Prior to EMS arrival.
element.v3Comment: This element is a component of the Utstein Cardiac Arrest Criteria as identified in the American Heart Association journal "Resuscitation" from 2004 entitled "Cardiac Arrest and Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Outcome Reports". http://circ.ahajournals.org/cgi/content/full/110/21/3385

asserts.assert: AED Use Prior to EMS Arrival should be recorded when Cardiac Arrest is "Yes, Prior to EMS Arrival".
AED Use Prior to EMS Arrival should only be recorded when Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
When AED Use Prior to EMS Arrival has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When AED Use Prior to EMS Arrival is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
